definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The Lahti orchestra has the most extensive cooperation with the world of business.
sentences.chinese: 拉赫蒂交響樂團與企業界與着最廣泛的合作。

sentences.english: The London Symphony Orchestra  broadcasts every Sunday on London Station.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦交響樂團每星期日都在倫敦電臺演出節目。

sentences.english: He worked with the BBC Philharmonic and the Royal Opera House in London.
sentences.chinese: 他在倫敦曾與BBC交響樂團和英國皇家歌劇院合作。

sentences.english: Since then, there was an orchestra which was named after the city.
sentences.chinese: 從此，杭城也有了以自己城市命名的交響樂團。

sentences.english: After the symphony orchestra finished its performance, the chairman stepped on platform.
sentences.chinese: 在交響樂團表演完後，主席走上講臺。

sentences.english: He is currently a second violin section player of the National Symphony Orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 現任國家交響樂團小提琴演奏員。

sentences.english: He played the French horn in an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在一個交響樂團裏演奏法國號。

sentences.english: The orchestra eggs the soloist on with its regular quavers.
sentences.chinese: 交響樂團用有規律的八分音符慫恿着獨奏者。

sentences.english: Zhou said Liu Wei should join the Shanghai Symphony Orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 周李波說劉偉完全有資格加入上海交響樂團。

sentences.english: The orchestra was working up to a crescendo.
sentences.chinese: 交響樂團即將演奏到音量漸強的一節。

sentences.english: He plays the pipe in the orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在交響樂團演奏管樂器。

sentences.english: I hear that you have a Italy Symphony Orchestra concert on the 15th evening.
sentences.chinese: 聽說15號晚上意大利交響樂團要在貴院演奏。

sentences.english: It is to hope to take an examination of Beijing philharmonic, 2 it is meet again of Chen Ya of become reconciled brother.
sentences.chinese: 一是希望考入北京交響樂團，二是和好兄弟陳亞重逢。

sentences.english: But the Orchestra had pried open a door shut for 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 但是，費城交響樂團打開一扇關閉了25年的大門。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Symphony Orchestra (GSO) was founded in 1957.
sentences.chinese: 廣州交響樂團創建於1957年。

sentences.english: The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache .
sentences.chinese: 英國廣播公司交響樂團演奏起來揮灑自如。
